name: Winding Heat
overview:
Winding Heat (ワインディングヒート Waindingu Hīto?) is a racing game developed and published by Konami for arcade platforms in 1996. It is the sequel to Road Fighter and Midnight Run.
It first appeared in arcades in September, though most arcades did not receive their units until later. It is an improved version of Midnight Run: Road Fighter 2, though it has more of the normal or tuned cars, and the rules remain the same. Unlike Midnight Run, it takes place on touge roads.

The cabinet came in two configurations: a sitdown version with a 50-inch monitor and an upright version with a 25-inch monitor. Cabinets can be linked to support up to four players.
